intro: Purpurella itatiaiae, commonly known as the Itatiaia violet, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
